document.masterDocTitle: On the transference of Ataxia tibialis Schaeffer to Bisaltes (Bisaltes) Thomson with synonymies and new records in the genus (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the transference of Ataxia tibialis Schaeffer to Bisaltes (Bisaltes) Thomson with synonymies and new records in the genus (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Museu de Zoologia Universidade de São Paulo São Paulo, SP, Brazil toncriss @ uol. com. br https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0001 - 7128 - 1418
Formerly, American Coleoptera Museum 8734 Paisano Pass San Antonio, TX 78255 - 3523, USA

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks.
Bisaltes ( Bisaltes ) bimaculatus
is dorsally very similar to
B. ( B. ) uniformis
, and
B. ( B. ) tibialis
, but differs from both by having the metanepisternum dark, and by the presence of one dark elliptical or subrounded dark macula on each side of abdominal ventrite I, which are absent in the latter two species.

This species was already illustrated by Monné et al. (2012) , and Nascimento and Bravo (2015) . However, the holotype and the ventral and lateral habitus showing the dark ventral maculae were never illustrated. Breuning (1971) suggested that
B. ( B. ) obliquatus
(now a synonym of
B. ( B. ) uniformis
) could be only a variety of
B. ( B. ) bimaculatus
. However, the dark maculae on ventral surface of
B. ( B. ) bimaculatus
are always present and never present in
B. ( B. ) uniformis
.

Material examined.
BRAZIL , no more data: 1 female ( MZSP ). BAHIA : 1 female , no date indicated, Bondar col. ( MZSP ). MINAS GERAIS : Jampruca , 1 male , no more data ( MZSP ). ESPÍRITO SANTO : Córrego do Itá , 1 male ,
X.1954
, J. Zikán col. ( MZSP )
;
Linhares , Parque Sooretama , 1 male ,
17–27.X.1962
, F.S. Pereira col. ( MZSP ). RIO DE JANEIRO : Itatiaia , 1 female ,
XI.1968
, former Diringshofen collection ( MZSP )
;
